poem:
Title: The Albatross of Polls

Polls whisper, the wail of democracy,
spoon-fed to the unfledged masses.
Two faces loom, rampant, Trump, Biden,
in the war of electoral passes.
Veil not your fears, nor your hopes confine,
in the lair of states seven.
Fallow not the tilled mind,
for truth is not the poll's leaven.
Blink not, for the eagle yet soars,
in spite of whispered lore.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Don’t panic about presidential polls – yet Hello! Welcome back to our new US elections newsletter. Non-Trump supporters have been all jittery this week, after a poll appeared to show Joe Biden getting royally stuffed by Trump in the election. The poll had Trump leading Biden in six of the seven states that are key to becoming president. It might seem scary, yes, but it’s too soon to be completely terrified: we’ll look at why". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Don’t panic about presidential polls – yet Hello! Welcome back to our new US elections newsletter.
